content: Morning Rohan—congratulations again 🎉. Today’s debrief is about codifying what worked into your personal Peak Performance Playbook. We’ll cover biofeedback, nutrition, stress inoculation, and your own notes. Call is set for 7pm SGT, correct?
Yes confirmed Neel. 7pm works. Honestly, felt sharper than I have in years—keen to capture the details while still fresh.
Hi Rohan, just confirming everyone is dialed in for the debrief in 3 mins. Recording will be saved for reference.
Strong session. Next step is we’ll draft the first version of your Peak Performance Playbook this week. That way you’ll have a replicable protocol before your next big presentation.
Perfect. Felt structured—like having a pit crew. Let’s definitely get that playbook in writing.

Morning Rohan. Pulled your CGM traces from last week. Here’s the quinoa test meal chart 📊. Your glucose spiked mildly but returned to baseline within ~60 mins. Very different from 3 months ago. Clear indicator your metabolic flexibility is improving.
That’s reassuring. Honestly didn’t feel any crash after the meal either. This is the kind of data that makes the changes tangible 👍
Exactly Rohan. The absence of post-meal fatigue matches what the numbers show. We’ll keep layering in complex carbs like quinoa and sweet potato, gradually increasing variety.
Hi Rohan, tomorrow we’ll close the loop on your keto experiment formally. Advik will present a full analysis of the data and focus scores. Does 8pm SGT work?
Yes 8 works. Looking forward to seeing it packaged properly.

Here’s the summary: during keto, your average focus self-ratings improved by 18%. HRV stabilized at a higher baseline. Productivity logs matched this. Officially confirming it was a positive phase, though reintroduction of carbs has not diminished gains.
That lines up with my experience. Great to have the data back it. Let’s call this one a win.
Logged as complete ✅. Documenting ‘Keto Experiment’ as a successful intervention in your longitudinal record.

Rohan, your keynote success was partly physiology, partly psychology. To strengthen resilience further, I’d recommend establishing a formal baseline of mental health. A structured review can help quantify stress and mood, building robustness for future events.
Makes sense. Is the idea that a stronger mental health baseline provides a buffer against potential POTS/long COVID flare-ups under stress, similar to how training built a physical buffer?
Exactly. Psychological resilience and autonomic stability are deeply connected. A stronger mental baseline reduces vulnerability to physiological flare-ups during stress.
Understood. Let’s move forward with the review. Please coordinate with Sarah on scheduling.
Got it. I’ll research a clinical psychologist who specializes in executive performance, vet credentials, and coordinate with Sarah for timing. You won’t need to manage a thing.

Rohan, now that the keynote is behind you, let’s evolve the training. This week I’d like to introduce a ‘Metabolic Flexibility Workout’: 30 min fasted Zone 2 cardio. It’ll help your body adapt to both fat and carb utilization.
Sounds good Rachel. Tomorrow morning I can give it a go. Will report back.
Completed the fasted Zone 2 just now. Felt steady, not depleted. HR was consistent. Actually clearer headed afterwards.
That’s a great first response 👍. We’ll keep this as a weekly stimulus and build duration gradually.
Quick update—shortlisted 2 psychologists with strong executive-performance backgrounds. I’ll send Sarah the profiles today for scheduling.
Thanks Ruby. Appreciate the speed 🙏

Ran comparisons: during keto you logged fewer subjective dips post-meal; during carb reintroduction, no negative change in HRV or focus noted. So, reintroduction appears successful—no trade-offs detected.
That’s the balance I was hoping for. Let’s keep iterating but I feel confident.
Rohan, suggestion: keep carbs earlier in the day for now. It’ll support evening recovery while avoiding any potential late glucose elevations. We’ll retest in a month.
Got it Carla. Breakfast/lunch carbs, lighter dinners. Easy enough.
Noted with Sarah: she’ll slot psychologist review for early Feb. You’ll just get a calendar invite—no action needed on your side.
Appreciate it Ruby. You make this frictionless.
Did another fasted Zone 2 this morning—slightly tougher today, HR spiked higher. Still finished it, but more effort.
That’s normal Rohan. Variability can come from sleep or stress. Important thing is you completed it. We’ll track trend over weeks.
Checked your Garmin sync—HRV was a bit lower last night, likely why HR felt higher this morning. Nothing concerning, just day-to-day variation.
That explains it. Good to know it’s just normal variance.
Rohan, next week we’ll formalize the Peak Performance Playbook doc—concise, clear steps for pre-event prep, nutrition, mental, physical. It becomes your manual for high-stakes situations.
Excellent. That’ll be a valuable asset. Thanks for leading this Neel.
Morning! Small housekeeping—lab work for your quarterly diagnostics is due in mid-Feb. I’ll coordinate with Sarah so it’s seamless around your travel.
Thanks for the reminder Ruby. Please just make sure it doesn’t clash with my Jakarta week.
Rohan, quick note—the carb rotation you’re on is textbook. Seeing both data and subjective alignment is rare. We’ll hold this pattern steady for a month before adding variety.
Great to hear. Honestly, I feel the program’s really clicking now. Appreciate the whole team’s effort.
